data.quote: D'oh! -Homer, when he sees or eats food like donuts
Woohoo...! -Homer's common catchphrase
If something's hard to do, it's not worth doing. -Homer discussing work.
The Simpsons are going to ______ -Homer when the family is about to go on vacation to somewhere.
Oh Homie. -Marge Simpson's love catchphrase
Mmmm. -Marge Simpson's famous catchphrase
You have to stick it out even if you picked a loser...Til the bitter end.... -Marge Simpson, about loyalty (and totally not about marriage.)
Eat my shorts! -Bart's catchphrase

Aside from the fact that he has the same frailties as all human beings, he's the only father I have. Therefore, he is my model of manhood, and my estimation of him will govern the prospects of my adult relationships. So I hope you bear in mind that any knock at him is a knock at me. And I am far too young to defend myself against such onslaughts. -Lisa to Patty about Homer Simpson.
Daddy. -Maggie's first canon word outside the Tracey Ullman shorts.
Goo. -Maggie's second canon word outside the Tracy Ullman shorts.
I think.. 1,000 is a number. -Abraham Simpson trying to figure out the message he said in church in The Simpsons movie

I fell 8,000 feet onto a pile of jagged rocks! Of course, folks were tougher in those days. I was jitterbugging that very night. -Abraham Simpson explaining to his son what happened to his fall at the Murderhorn following C.W McAllister's betrayal.

I grew up with a single mother, and although we didn't have a lot of money, she cared a great deal about what we ate. We were the original health-food family. We shopped at what were called health-food stores before Whole Foods - everything came from bins.

I eventually made the reunion with my father that I'd used as a default daydream throughout my childhood, but by then, we'd both outgrown the only relationship we could have had to each other. I was over 30 by the time I met him again and no longer needed a father.
When that Simpson boy showed up, it took years off my life!” -Clancy Bouvier in The Way We Was
Don't look at me! DON'T LOOK AT ME!!” -Clancy Bouvier in Fear of Flying (flashback)
I have laryngitis and it hurts to talk. So I'll say one thing. You never do anything right.
(To Homer) You ruined my nap, just like you ruined my daughter's life.
As far as I'm concerned, I have no brother.
Listen to me. Here's what you do. From now on before you say anything, say to yourself, 'If I was ever sure of anything, I'm sure of this!' Do you understand?
Homer, I forgive you. You can call me brother and I can do the same.
I like to cry at the ocean, because only there do my tears seem small.
Ha, Ha! I touched your heart!
God, if you don't bring my Lisa home safe, ants will burn tonight!
A fat kid with a dream. I can't compete with that.
Trust me Bart, it's better to walk in on both your parents than on just one of them.
I never would have suspected the one criminal in town.
It is with great pride that I place the safety of our city in the hands of the first four people who showed up.
In you go, boys. We've got everything--warm beds, square meals, homeless women.
We have nothing to fear but the aliens and their vastly superior killing technology!
When I look at people I don't see colors; I just see crackpot religions.
Ah he's a dumb kid, but he's an above average dog. Roll over, son!
The minute you go undercover, it's like you don't even know me!
Tell him it's the 'worst prognosis ever!' Hee hee hee.
Without further ado, I give you the man who puts young people behind bars, where they belong, TV's 'Matlock'.
Don't thank me - thank the knife!
